alert.note: Alert for George; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western George, southeastern Perry and northeastern Stone Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 229 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Wiggins, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western George, southeastern Perry and northeastern Stone Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
